required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study Comparing Early Conversion to Extended-Release Tacrolimus (ENVARSUS XR) to Immediate-Release Tacrolimus in Lung Transplant Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: Patients undergoing a lung transplant will be enrolled. All patients will undergo lung transplantation with standard post-operative management, including triple immunosuppression. As soon as the patient is deemed appropriate to take medications via the oral route, they will be converted from IR tacrolimus to Envarsus XR. Patients will be followed per site's standard of care.

detailed_description.textblock: Lung transplantation will be performed per standard-of-care techniques. All post-transplant management, including initial triple immunosuppression, will be carried out per standard of care. Once the patient is able to take medications via the oral route, they will be converted to Envarsus XR, which will be maintained for the first year post-lung transplant.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of patients remaining on Envarsus XR
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint, percentage of patients remaining on Envarsus XR at 1-year, will be measured as a single endpoint on a nominal scale. It will be analyzed using descriptive statistics.

secondary_outcome.description: Percent of patients with treated episodes of rejection. Burden of cellular rejection as measured by the Composite rejection standardized score (CRSS) at 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of chronic lung allograft dysfunction (CLAD)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of chronic lung allograft dysfunction (CLAD) at 1 year will be presented as odds ratio with 95% confidence intervals and compared between groups using logistic regression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of de novo Donor-Specific Antibody (DSA)
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of de novo Donor-Specific Antibody (DSA) at 1 year will be presented as odds ratio with 95% confidence intervals and compared using between groups using logistic regression.

secondary_outcome.measure: One year survival percentage in participants
secondary_outcome.description: Mortality a 1 year post-transplant will be compared using Kaplan-Meier survival curves and log-rank analysis.

arm_group.description: Envarsus XR to be initiated once patient is tolerating oral medications
Historical cohort of patients maintained on IR tacrolimus following transplant

intervention.description: Envarsus XR is an FDA-approved drug for the prophylaxis of organ rejection in de novo kidney transplant patients or in kidney transplant patients converted from IR tacrolimus when used with other immunosuppressants. Envarsus XR is a novel extended-release formulation of tacrolimus created using MeltDose technology. Envarsus XR is available in tablet form. It is available in 0.75, 1, and 4 mg tablets.

Historical cohort of 20 subjects who will be maintained on IR tacrolimus following transplant. Dosing will be converted on an individual basis (Capsules: 0.5 mg, 1 mg and 5 mg or Injection: 5 mg) . All patients will be initiated on IR tacrolimus either under the tongue (sublingual) or as a solution given through a tube placed through the nose into the stomach, which is standard of care for all lung transplant recipients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Prospective arm:
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Received a lung transplant at NYU Langone Health
- Be able to convert to Envarsus XR within the first month post-transplant
- Able and willing to provide informed consent
Historical control:
- Age ≥ 18 years
- Received a lung transplant at NYU Langone Health
- Completed one year from transplant on IR tacrolimus
Exclusion Criteria:
Prospective arm:
- Contraindication to tacrolimus due to allergic or adverse reactions
- Pregnant or nursing women
- Multi-organ transplant recipient
Historical control:
- Contraindication to tacrolimus due to allergic or adverse reactions (not including chronic kidney disease)
- Multi-organ transplant recipient

patient_data.ipd_description: IPD collected for this study will be used for the sole purpose of this study.
